title: Frontend: Update Channels page with dynamic forms
description:
Replace static channel creation form with schema-driven dynamic form.

Subtasks:
1. Add channel type selector dropdown
2. Fetch channel schema when type is selected
3. Replace static form fields with SchemaForm component
4. Show channel description and required fields guidance

Definition of Done:
- User can select channel type from dropdown
- Form fields change based on selected channel type
- All 20+ channel types have correct fields
- Required fields are validated before submit
- Hints shown for each field
- Examples displayed for guidance
- Add Channel works for all channel types

title: Backend: Create channel schema endpoints
description:
Create REST API endpoints to expose channel configuration schemas.

Subtasks:
1. Create channel schema types in Rust (FieldSchema, ChannelSchema structs)
2. Implement GET /api/schema/channels - returns all channel types with schemas
3. Implement GET /api/schema/channels/{type} - returns schema for specific channel
4. Ensure all 20+ channel types are included (cli, telegram, discord, slack, mattermost, webhook, imessage, matrix, signal, whatsapp, linq, nextcloud_talk, irc, lark, feishu, dingtalk, qq, nostr, clawdtalk, email)

Definition of Done:
- GET /api/schema/channels returns JSON array of all channel types
- Each channel type includes: type, name, description, fields array
- Each field includes: name, type, required, hint, example
- Field types supported: string, number, boolean, array
- GET /api/schema/channels/telegram returns correct schema
- GET /api/schema/channels/webhook returns correct schema
- All required fields marked correctly
- API requires auth (uses existing require_auth)
- Returns 404 for unknown channel types

title: Frontend: Create schema fetch hooks and dynamic form component
description:
Create TypeScript types, API functions, and React components for schema-driven forms.

Subtasks:
1. Add schema API fetch functions to web/src/lib/api.ts
2. Create useChannelSchema and useProviderSchema React hooks
3. Create SchemaForm component that renders fields based on schema
4. Support field types: string (text input), password, number, boolean (toggle), array (textarea/json), select

Definition of Done:
- getChannelSchema(type) fetches and returns channel schema
- getProviderSchema(type) fetches and returns provider schema
- SchemaForm component renders all field types correctly
- Required fields show validation
- Hints and examples displayed
- Component handles loading and error states
- Works with Channels and Providers pages
